He is happy with his kind master and the occasional freedom to roam.

He seemed content and happy to be riding with the mistress.

Ginger.reason: Terrible because Ginger's story reveals her difficult past as a former carriage horse and she remarks about how hard her life has been.
Ginger has witnessed a very disturbing event and is upset and traumatized by the swift death of a friendly horse for no good reason.
Ginger is upset to have been displaced from her box, but has not yet had a chance to fully interact with Black Beauty.
She had a traumatic upbringing and a cruel trainer, so while she admires Black Beauty's kind upbringing, she is still unhappy with her own experience.
Ginger has been through a lot of trauma and mistreatment at the hands of humans, and still harbors a deep distrust of them despite some improvement in her temperament since arriving at Birtwick Park.
She was excited and animated during the conversation but also angry and bitter towards men.
Ginger is miserable as she shares stories of abuse and mistreatment alongside Black Beauty.
